byline.contributor:
Kitty Bennett and Susan C. Beachy contributed research.

Video footage courtesy of Animal Planet / Sea Shepherd Global, Selase Kove-Seyram for The New York Times. Video editing by Alexandra Garcia and Jessica Naudziunas.

Produced by Jacky Myint, Derek Watkins and Hannah Fairfield.

abstract: Pursuit of trawler Thunder, one of world's most notorious fish poachers, by ships operated by environmental organization Sea Shepherd shows how lack of governmental action has left vigilantes to police world's oceans; Sea Shepherd ships Bob Barker and Sam Simon tracked Thunder for 110 days and more than 10,000 nautical miles to curb its illegal fishing activities (Series: The Outlaw Ocean).
lead_paragraph: For 110 days and across two seas and three oceans, crews stalked a fugitive fishing ship considered the world’s most notorious poacher.

headline.main: A Renegade Trawler, Hunted for 10,000 Miles by Vigilantes
headline.print_headline: A Renegade Trawler, Chased by Eco-Vigilantes

snippet: For 110 days and across two seas and three oceans, crews stalked a fugitive fishing ship considered the world’s most notorious poacher.
